title: Liaoning International Cooperation Group sent a team to help Cabo Verde government defending flood
description: In September and October of 2020, the Liaoning International Cooperation Group sent a group to help in drainage efforts after Cabo Verde was affected by floods in September. This is a part of the fourth phase of the Cabo Verde Integrated Technical Cooperation Project. It is unclear how many members were on the team.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Liaoning International Cooperation Group sent a team to help Cabo Verde government defending flood

# Description
In September and October of 2020, the Liaoning International Cooperation Group sent a group to help in drainage efforts after Cabo Verde was affected by floods in September. This is a part of the fourth phase of the Cabo Verde Integrated Technical Cooperation Project. It is unclear how many members were on the team.
justification: Project focuses on emergency response and flood defense, with no clear energy or environmental impact
evidence: Drainage efforts after floods, humanitarian assistance focus

title: Chinese Government donates medical supplies to the Government of Cabo Verde
description: On April 20, 2020, the Chinese Government donated medical supplies to the Government of Cabo Verde. The donation includes  12,000 masks, 2,000 personal protective suits, 500 infrared thermometers, 2,000 pairs of goggles, 10,000 gloves and 10,000 disposable shoe covers. The Health Minister of Cabo Verde received the donations. The donation is used to fight the COVID-19 epidemic as it goes through Cabo Verde.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector

# Title

# Description

The donation includes  12,000 masks, 2,000 personal protective suits, 500 infrared thermometers, 2,000 pairs of goggles, 10,000 gloves and 10,000 disposable shoe covers. The Health Minister of Cabo Verde received the donations. The donation is used to fight the COVID-19 epidemic as it goes through Cabo Verde.
justification: Project is a humanitarian donation of medical supplies unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Medical supplies donation including masks, protective suits, thermometers, and other healthcare equipment

title: China Eximbank suspends debt service payments from Government of Cape Verde in 2020
description: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic and the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors meeting that took place on April 15, 2020 and on November 13, 2020, the Chinese Government agreed to work with other G20 members to implement the Debt Service Suspension Initiative (DSSI). As part of DSSI, China Eximbank and the Government of Cape Verde signed a debt suspension agreement during calendar year 2020 (most likely between May 2020 and July 2020). Under the terms of the agreement, the lender agreed to suspend principal and interest payments due in 2020 under one or more loan agreements. The total estimated suspension amount is unknown but was likely no more than $2,710,000 (the total estimated suspension amount in 2021).  However, at the time that the parties signed the debt suspension agreement, they both acknowledged that the total suspension amount would ultimately be determined at the end of the suspension period (since loan disbursements could be made during the suspension period and the lender agreed to suspend the payment of interest accrued on any disbursements during the suspension period). The lender and borrower agreed that the suspension of debt service would be undertaken on a net present value (NPV)-neutral basis. Therefore, the borrower agreed to pay interest accrued on the amount outstanding under the total suspension amount (‘Suspension Interest’) by paying the Suspension Interest on the amount outstanding under each loan agreement’s suspension amount at the same rate of interest set forth in the original loan agreement.  Under the terms of the debt suspension agreement, the lender and the borrower also agreed that ‘[t]he suspension interest on the amount outstanding under the Suspension Amount concerning each Loan Agreement shall be calculated on the basis of the actual number of days elapsed and a year of 360 days, from and including the Repayment Date/Repayment Date of Principal and Interest falling within the Suspension Period to the date of payment in full of the corresponding Suspension Amount, and shall be paid in arrears on each Interest Payment Date under the corresponding Loan Agreement.’ The borrower also agreed that (1) ‘it shall continue to perform all its obligations […] under the Loan Agreements as supplemented and amended by [the debt suspension agreement]’; (2) ‘it shall use the created fiscal space to increase social, health, or economic spending in response to the COVID-19 crisis […]’ and ‘work closely with the International Financial Institutions who are expected to put in place a monitoring system’;  (3) ‘it shall disclose to the Lender all Public Sector Financial Commitments (as defined in the Government Finance Statistics Manual 2014 (GFSM2014)), respecting commercially sensitive information’; and (4) ‘it shall contract no new non-concessional debt during the Suspension Period, other than agreements under the DSSI’.
staff_comments: 1. AidData assumes that the same basic terms and conditions that governed China Eximbank’s DSSI (debt suspension) agreement with other governments also applied to its DSSI agreement that it signed with the Government of Cape Verde. Illustrative DSSI agreements can be accessed via https://www.dropbox.com/s/huwa695j3w9hwig/DSSI%20Agreement%20for%20Kyrgyz%20Republic.pdf?dl=0 and https://www.dropbox.com/s/67n1oq44it27kvu/3.%20Debt%20Suspension%20Agreement%20for%20GCL%20Other%20Projects.pdf?dl=0 and https://www.dropbox.com/s/n69i598f0fg7s80/6.%20Debt%20Suspension%20Agreement%20for%20PBC%20C2.pdf?dl=0.
combined_text:
# Sector
ACTION RELATING TO DEBT

# Title
China Eximbank suspends debt service payments from Government of Cape Verde in 2020

# Description
In response to the COVID-19 pandemic and the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors meeting that took place on April 15, 2020 and on November 13, 2020, the Chinese Government agreed to work with other G20 members to implement the Debt Service Suspension Initiative (DSSI). As part of DSSI, China Eximbank and the Government of Cape Verde signed a debt suspension agreement during calendar year 2020 (most likely between May 2020 and July 2020). Under the terms of the agreement, the lender agreed to suspend principal and interest payments due in 2020 under one or more loan agreements. The total estimated suspension amount is unknown but was likely no more than $2,710,000 (the total estimated suspension amount in 2021).  However, at the time that the parties signed the debt suspension agreement, they both acknowledged that the total suspension amount would ultimately be determined at the end of the suspension period (since loan disbursements could be made during the suspension period and the lender agreed to suspend the payment of interest accrued on any disbursements during the suspension period). The lender and borrower agreed that the suspension of debt service would be undertaken on a net present value (NPV)-neutral basis. Therefore, the borrower agreed to pay interest accrued on the amount outstanding under the total suspension amount (‘Suspension Interest’) by paying the Suspension Interest on the amount outstanding under each loan agreement’s suspension amount at the same rate of interest set forth in the original loan agreement.  Under the terms of the debt suspension agreement, the lender and the borrower also agreed that ‘[t]he suspension interest on the amount outstanding under the Suspension Amount concerning each Loan Agreement shall be calculated on the basis of the actual number of days elapsed and a year of 360 days, from and including the Repayment Date/Repayment Date of Principal and Interest falling within the Suspension Period to the date of payment in full of the corresponding Suspension Amount, and shall be paid in arrears on each Interest Payment Date under the corresponding Loan Agreement.’ The borrower also agreed that (1) ‘it shall continue to perform all its obligations […] under the Loan Agreements as supplemented and amended by [the debt suspension agreement]’; (2) ‘it shall use the created fiscal space to increase social, health, or economic spending in response to the COVID-19 crisis […]’ and ‘work closely with the International Financial Institutions who are expected to put in place a monitoring system’;  (3) ‘it shall disclose to the Lender all Public Sector Financial Commitments (as defined in the Government Finance Statistics Manual 2014 (GFSM2014)), respecting commercially sensitive information’; and (4) ‘it shall contract no new non-concessional debt during the Suspension Period, other than agreements under the DSSI’.
justification: Debt suspension agreement with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Debt service suspension agreement, focus on financial restructuring and COVID-19 response

title: ICBC provides $600 million loan for Phase 1 of 700 MW Sihanoukville CIIDG Coal-Fired Power Plant Construction Project
description: In May 2018, Cambodia’s Council of Ministers approved a proposal for the 700 MW Sihanoukville CIIDG Coal-Fired Power Plant Construction Project to be implemented on a build-own-operate-transfer (BOOT) basis through a 35-year concession agreement. Then, on April 15, 2020, Huadian Sihanoukville Power Generation Co Ltd. — a special purpose vehicle and joint venture of China Huadian Hong Kong Company Limited (CHDHK) and Cambodia International Investment Development Group (CIIDG) — signed a $600 million loan agreement with ICBC Asia and ICBC Phnom Penh Branch for Phase 1 of the 700 MW Sihanoukville CIIDG Coal-Fired Power Plant Construction Project.   The purpose of the project is to construct a 700 MW coal-field power plant on a 54.9 hectare parcel of land in the coastal district of Stung Hav within Preah Sihanouk Province. The power plant will consist of two 350 MW supercritical coal-fired power units. An 8,000-ton coal berth and a 1.5-kilometer 230 kV transmission line will also be built. Under the terms of a 35-year concession agreement, Huadian Sihanoukville Power Generation Co Ltd. will sell the power to Électricité du Cambodge (EdC) for $0.0743 per kilowatt hour (kWh). The power plant will be constructed in two phases, with each phase capable of producing about 350 MW (net) of baseload power. Phase 1 was originally expected to be connected to the national grid by 2023, and Phase 2 was originally expected to be connected to the national grid by 2024. Southwest Electric Power Design Institute (SWEPDI), a wholly-owned subsidiary of China Power Engineering, is the EPC contractor responsible for the implementation of Phase 1.   A formal groundbreaking ceremony for Phase 1 began on December 18, 2019. However, media reports indicate that the project’s environmental impact assessment (EIA) was not presented to the provincial government in a meeting until July 2020. At that meeting, the provincial government expressed support for the project, but stated the EIA still required national-level approval. Construction reportedly commenced on or around August 18, 2020.  Huadian Sihanoukville Power Generation Co Ltd (HSPGC) reportedly put online the "number-two unit" of its 700MW coal-fired HSPGC Power Plant on December 16, 2022.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the Sihanoukville CIIDG Power Station 2 Project and the CIIDG–Huadian Sihanoukville Coal Power Plant Project. The Chinese project title is 中国华电柬埔寨燃煤电厂项目 or 柬埔寨西哈努克港2×350MW燃煤电厂项目.  The Khmer project title is រោងចក្រអគ្គិសនី ដុត អានុភាព ២x៣៥០ មេ ហ្គា វ៉ ត់ របស់ ក្រុមហ៊ុន CIIDG និង CHDHK នៅ ខេត្ត ព្រះសីហនុ2. Cambodia International Investment Development Group (CIIDG), according to Cambodia’s company register, is owned by the wife of Cambodian Senator Lao Meng Khin. CIIDG is linked to several energy-generation and transmission projects, including a 405 MW coal plant adjacent to this project. 3. Huadian Sihanoukville Power Generation Co Ltd. was legally incorporated in October 2019.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
ICBC provides $600 million loan for Phase 1 of 700 MW Sihanoukville CIIDG Coal-Fired Power Plant Construction Project

# Description
In May 2018, Cambodia’s Council of Ministers approved a proposal for the 700 MW Sihanoukville CIIDG Coal-Fired Power Plant Construction Project to be implemented on a build-own-operate-transfer (BOOT) basis through a 35-year concession agreement. Then, on April 15, 2020, Huadian Sihanoukville Power Generation Co Ltd. — a special purpose vehicle and joint venture of China Huadian Hong Kong Company Limited (CHDHK) and Cambodia International Investment Development Group (CIIDG) — signed a $600 million loan agreement with ICBC Asia and ICBC Phnom Penh Branch for Phase 1 of the 700 MW Sihanoukville CIIDG Coal-Fired Power Plant Construction Project.   The purpose of the project is to construct a 700 MW coal-field power plant on a 54.9 hectare parcel of land in the coastal district of Stung Hav within Preah Sihanouk Province. The power plant will consist of two 350 MW supercritical coal-fired power units. An 8,000-ton coal berth and a 1.5-kilometer 230 kV transmission line will also be built. Under the terms of a 35-year concession agreement, Huadian Sihanoukville Power Generation Co Ltd. will sell the power to Électricité du Cambodge (EdC) for $0.0743 per kilowatt hour (kWh). The power plant will be constructed in two phases, with each phase capable of producing about 350 MW (net) of baseload power. Phase 1 was originally expected to be connected to the national grid by 2023, and Phase 2 was originally expected to be connected to the national grid by 2024. Southwest Electric Power Design Institute (SWEPDI), a wholly-owned subsidiary of China Power Engineering, is the EPC contractor responsible for the implementation of Phase 1.   A formal groundbreaking ceremony for Phase 1 began on December 18, 2019. However, media reports indicate that the project’s environmental impact assessment (EIA) was not presented to the provincial government in a meeting until July 2020. At that meeting, the provincial government expressed support for the project, but stated the EIA still required national-level approval. Construction reportedly commenced on or around August 18, 2020.  Huadian Sihanoukville Power Generation Co Ltd (HSPGC) reportedly put online the "number-two unit" of its 700MW coal-fired HSPGC Power Plant on December 16, 2022.
justification: Primary purpose is construction of a coal-fired power plant, which is environmentally harmful and inhibits energy transition
evidence: 700 MW coal-fired power plant, two 350 MW supercritical coal-fired power units, coal berth, and transmission line

title: Chinese National Health Commission sends 7-person medical team in March 2020 to the Cambodia Ministry of Health
description: On March 23, 2020, a private jet chartered to carry Covid-19 supplies as well as 7 Chinese medical experts touched down in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. The team, organized by the National Health Commission, consists of experts selected by the Health Commission of Guangxi Zhuang autonomous region. The team was greeted by Cambodian Minister of Health Mam Bunheng and Chinese Ambassador to Cambodia Wang Wentian at the Phnom Penh international airport. These experts were sent from south China's Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region to help combat COVID-19 throughout Cambodia.   They also brought with them Covid-19 supplies including ventilators, test kits, infrared temperature sensors, N95 protective masks, surgical masks, isolation gowns and medical protective suits (Linked to #93200). With test kits donated by the Chinese government earlier in the month (Recorded in #90959), these two batches of donations are worth over 4 million RMB.  The experts offered training for Cambodian medics on personal protection, installation and use of lab equipment, as well as treatment of COVID-19 patients in severe and critical conditions. The team reportedly returned to China on April 7, 2020.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese National Health Commission sends 7-person medical team in March 2020 to the Cambodia Ministry of Health

# Description
On March 23, 2020, a private jet chartered to carry Covid-19 supplies as well as 7 Chinese medical experts touched down in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. The team, organized by the National Health Commission, consists of experts selected by the Health Commission of Guangxi Zhuang autonomous region. The team was greeted by Cambodian Minister of Health Mam Bunheng and Chinese Ambassador to Cambodia Wang Wentian at the Phnom Penh international airport. These experts were sent from south China's Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region to help combat COVID-19 throughout Cambodia.   They also brought with them Covid-19 supplies including ventilators, test kits, infrared temperature sensors, N95 protective masks, surgical masks, isolation gowns and medical protective suits (Linked to #93200). With test kits donated by the Chinese government earlier in the month (Recorded in #90959), these two batches of donations are worth over 4 million RMB.  The experts offered training for Cambodian medics on personal protection, installation and use of lab equipment, as well as treatment of COVID-19 patients in severe and critical conditions. The team reportedly returned to China on April 7, 2020.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare support and medical training, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical team deployment, COVID-19 supplies donation, medical training activities

title: Chinese Embassy in Cambodia provides flood relief kits to 800 families in the Dangkor district of Cambodia
description: On October 20, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Cambodia provided flood relief kits to 800 families in the Dangkor district of Cambodia. Chinese Ambassador Wang Wentian, joined by Cambodian lawmaker Hun Many, president of the Union of Youth Federations of Cambodia, and Phnom Penh governor Khuong Sreng, distributed the relief items at three different locations in the district. Each kit contained rice, noodles, tinned fish, soya sauce, drinking water and a 50,000 Cambodian riel each.  As of October 21, 2020, Seasonal rains, exacerbated by tropical storms, had caused floods in 19 of the kingdom's 25 cities and provinces since the beginning of the month. By this time, 25 people had been killed and 37,396 others had been forced to evacuate.
combined_text:
# Sector
RECONSTRUCTION RELIEF AND REHABILITATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy in Cambodia provides flood relief kits to 800 families in the Dangkor district of Cambodia

# Description
On October 20, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Cambodia provided flood relief kits to 800 families in the Dangkor district of Cambodia. Chinese Ambassador Wang Wentian, joined by Cambodian lawmaker Hun Many, president of the Union of Youth Federations of Cambodia, and Phnom Penh governor Khuong Sreng, distributed the relief items at three different locations in the district. Each kit contained rice, noodles, tinned fish, soya sauce, drinking water and a 50,000 Cambodian riel each.  As of October 21, 2020, Seasonal rains, exacerbated by tropical storms, had caused floods in 19 of the kingdom's 25 cities and provinces since the beginning of the month. By this time, 25 people had been killed and 37,396 others had been forced to evacuate.
justification: Project is focused on humanitarian relief with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Flood relief kits distribution, humanitarian focus, no energy or infrastructure components

title: Chinese Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs donates 200,000 doses of cattle vaccines to Cambodia
description: On December 21, 2020, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs of China (MARA) donated 200,000 doses of cattle vaccines to the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries (MAFF) of Cambodia for emergency use in a handover ceremony held in Beijing. The vaccines included doses for foot-and-mouth disease (FMD) and Hemorrhagic Septicemia (HS).   This donation followed the formal request by MAFF on December 4, 2020 for assistance controlling cattle diseases. On December 13, 2020, MARA responded with a letter agreeing to provide 200,000 doses of vaccines stating that the doses had been developed and donated by Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences's veterinarian lab in Lanzhou and China Agricultural Vet.Bio. Science and Technology via the coordination of MARA.    The handover ceremony on December 21, 2020 was attended by Vice Minister Zhang Taolin and H.E. Ms. Khek M Caimealy, Ambassador of Cambodia to China and was presided over by Chief Agronomist Guang Defu.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs donates 200,000 doses of cattle vaccines to Cambodia

# Description
On December 21, 2020, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs of China (MARA) donated 200,000 doses of cattle vaccines to the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries (MAFF) of Cambodia for emergency use in a handover ceremony held in Beijing. The vaccines included doses for foot-and-mouth disease (FMD) and Hemorrhagic Septicemia (HS).   This donation followed the formal request by MAFF on December 4, 2020 for assistance controlling cattle diseases. On December 13, 2020, MARA responded with a letter agreeing to provide 200,000 doses of vaccines stating that the doses had been developed and donated by Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences's veterinarian lab in Lanzhou and China Agricultural Vet.Bio. Science and Technology via the coordination of MARA.    The handover ceremony on December 21, 2020 was attended by Vice Minister Zhang Taolin and H.E. Ms. Khek M Caimealy, Ambassador of Cambodia to China and was presided over by Chief Agronomist Guang Defu.
justification: Project is a vaccine donation for agricultural purposes with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of 200,000 doses of cattle vaccines for disease control in Cambodia

title: Bank of China donates USD 20,000 worth of COVID-19 materials in April 2020 to the Cambodian Ministry of Health
description: On April 1, 2020, the Phnom Penh Branch of Bank of China donated 200 sets of protective clothing, 500 pairs of goggles, 1,000 KN95 masks, 10,000 medical masks and other anti-epidemic materials totaling about USD 20,000 in worth to the Cambodian Ministry of Health. In addition, the branch donated 3,000 USD to the anti-epidemic fund initiated and established by the Chinese Chamber of Commerce in Cambodia.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Bank of China donates USD 20,000 worth of COVID-19 materials in April 2020 to the Cambodian Ministry of Health

# Description
On April 1, 2020, the Phnom Penh Branch of Bank of China donated 200 sets of protective clothing, 500 pairs of goggles, 1,000 KN95 masks, 10,000 medical masks and other anti-epidemic materials totaling about USD 20,000 in worth to the Cambodian Ministry of Health. In addition, the branch donated 3,000 USD to the anti-epidemic fund initiated and established by the Chinese Chamber of Commerce in Cambodia.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare donations with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of COVID-19 protective materials and funds to Cambodian Ministry of Health

title: Chinese Government donates third batch of anti-epidemic materials in June 2020 to Cambodia Ministry of Health
description: On June 3, 2020, the handover ceremony of the third batch of anti-epidemic materials aided by the Chinese government to Cambodia was held in Phnom Penh at the Cambodian Ministry of Health. The ceremony was attended by Chinese Ambassador to Cambodia Wang Wentian and Cambodia’s Health Minister Mam Bunheng. These batches contained a variety of supplies including nucleic acid detection reagents for COVID-19, medical protective clothing, medical protective masks, medical surgical masks, medical isolation goggles and infrared thermometers.
combined_text:
